newsitem.title: MALAWI: MALAWI MINISTER SAYS UNIONS HINDERING PRODUCTIVITY.
newsitem.headline: MALAWI MINISTER SAYS UNIONS HINDERING PRODUCTIVITY.

text.p: Malawi's Trade and Industry Minister Chakakala Chaziya launched a scathing attack on labour unions on Thursday, blaming them for the country's falling productivity.
He told the opening ceremony of a trade exhibition that unions were demanding more than their due, under the guise of freedom of expression and association.
"The demands should always depend on your increased productivity," Chaziya said.

He was particularly critical of state employees for going on strike for over six weeks to push for a 100 percent wage increase. They suspended the action a fortnight ago, pending the outcome of further talks with the goverrnment.
The minister also accused some public officials of hampering the government's efforts to improve the economy, often by using bureaucratic procedures and delaying tactics in processing documentation.
"This is frustrating to any serious business person," he said.
